Event.0: American Pharoah won the Belmont Stakes, becoming the first Thoroughbred in more than 35 years to capture horse racing's Triple Crown.
Event.1: Actess Melanie Griffith (45) and actor Antonio Banderas (53) file for divorce citing irreconcilable differences after 18 years of marriage
Event.2: Gossip Girl star Kelly Rutherford (40) divorces German entrepreneur Daniel Giersch (34) due to irreconcilable differences after 2 years of marriage
Event.3: For her performance in A Raisin in the Sun, Phylicia Rashad became the first African American to win a Tony Award for best actress.
Event.4: TV sitcom "Sex and the City" premieres in the US on HBO, starring Sarah Jessica Parker, Kim Cattrall, Kristin Davis and Cynthia Nixon
Event.5: French Open Women's Tennis: 17 year old German Steffi Graf beats World #1 Martina Navratilova 6-4, 4-6, 8-6; Graf's first Grand Slam victory
Event.6: 30,000 Israeli troops invade Lebanon to drive out the PLO
Event.7: Israel invaded Lebanon and subsequently defeated the Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO), the Syrian armed forces, and assorted leftist Lebanese groups.
Event.8: David Bowie releases his breakthrough album "The Rise & Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars"
Event.9: U.S. Senator Robert F. Kennedy died of a bullet wound from assassin Sirhan Sirhan.
Event.10:
Paul Giamatti
American actor
was born
Event.11: Three-time Olympic Champion figure skater Sonja Henie (44) weds Norwegian shipping magnate and art patron Niels Onstad (47)
Event.12: Swedish tennis player Björn Borg, who was considered one of the sport's greatest competitors, was born.
Event.13:
Björn Borg
Swedish tennis player
was born
Event.14: Operation Overlord: D-Day begins as the 150,000 strong Allied Expeditionary Force lands in Normandy, France, during World War II
Event.15:
Normandy Invasion begun
Led by U.S. General Dwight D. Eisenhower, an Allied armada of ships, planes, and landing craft and some 156,000 troops began the invasion of northern France from England this day in 1944—the famous “D-Day” of World War II.
Event.16: "The Thin Man" actress Myrna Loy (36) weds John Hertz Jr. in New York City
Event.17: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC)—a U.S. regulatory agency—was established.
Event.18: The automobile manufacturer Chrysler Corporation was incorporated, with Walter P. Chrysler as president.
Event.19: The death of Yuan Shikai, ruler of much of China since 1912, causes the central government to virtually collapse in the face of warlords, including Sun Yat-sen
Event.20:
Sukarno
president of Indonesia
was born
Event.21: British Open Golf, Muirfield: Scotsman James Braid wins first of 5 Open titles by 3 strokes from Harry Vardon of Jersey
Event.22:
Thomas Mann
German author
was born
Event.23:
Alexandra
empress consort of Russia
was born
Event.24: Sophia of Nassau marries the future King Oscar II of Sweden-Norway
Event.25: George Williams originated the Young Men's Christian Association (YMCA) in London.
Event.26: French transport the 1st African slaves to Louisiana
Event.27: Pope Gregory XV created the Congregation for the Propagation of the Faith for the organization and direction of the missions of the Roman Catholic Church to the non-Christian world.
Event.28: Gustav Vasa is elected King of Sweden, marking the end of the Kalmar Union
